messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Digest Number 1070/Herbal Supplement
messages.msgSnippet: Tia & Nicki, I believe it was called PediActive.  I seem to remember it being in a purple bottle but I could be wrong.  I had to get it from my healthfood
messages.messageBody:
Tia & Nicki,
I believe it was called PediActive.  I seem to remember it being in a purple bottle but I could be wrong.  I had to get it from my healthfood store. - Collette
----- Original Message -----
From: RValvo7626@...
To: Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Sunday, April 01, 2001 3:13 PM
Subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Digest Number 1070

In a message dated 3/30/01 7:25:36 PM Mountain Daylight Time,
Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:

<<  Dh and I did try an herbal supplement for "active" children to help his
neurotransmitters connect so stepson could think better and control himself.
>>

    May I ask what this herbal supplement was? I do not label my dd except to
say she is a highly spirited individual. (that's an understatement lol)  .
Our concern is her inability to chill out. If she freaks over something she
cannot unlock and it escalates. We are moving to a condo from a ranch and I
am already tried of asking her to lower her voice or walk instead of skip. 
Dh is going to be beside himself the first night her nose is bugging her and
she "can't handle it" <------ her words and screams. I use Rescue Remedy for
some things but not a lot. Also we tried Valerian for sleep troubles but it
didn't seem to help.

    TIA       NICKI~
